item.title: 三星股价上涨，因有报道称其已开始大规模生产人工智能芯片
item.description: 三星电子股价一度上涨6.4%，此前有报道称该公司即将开始量产HBM4内存芯片，该芯片被用于人工智能基础设施的建设。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co.’s shares climbed as much as 6.4% after a report that the company will soon begin mass production of HBM4 memory chips, used as part of the buildout for artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: KDDI股价暴跌，因虚假销售调查造成16亿美元损失
item.description: 日本第二大电信运营商KDDI公司股价暴跌，创近六年最大跌幅。该公司表示，针对虚假广告销售的调查将导致其截至3月的财年集团收入数据进行修正。【原文：KDDI Corp. shares plunged by the most in almost six years after Japan’s second-largest telecom provider said an ongoing investigation into fictitious ad sales will result in revisions to its group revenue for the year ending March.】

item.title: 日本股市创历史新高，高市早苗胜选点燃支出预期
item.description: 东京股市上涨，因首相高市早苗在周日选举中取得历史性胜利，引发市场对政府将加大对国防和人工智能等关键产业投入的预期。【原文：Japanese stocks rallied in Tokyo as Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s historic win in Sunday’s election ignited expectations of more government spending for key industries, including defense and AI.】

item.title: 招聘人员称英国就业市场正走出最艰难时期
item.description: 英国就业市场正开始趋稳，此前企业经历了一段因增税预期而动荡的时期。这项调查受到英国央行利率决策者的密切关注。【原文：The UK’s jobs sector is starting to stabilize as businesses emerge from a period marked by speculation of higher taxes, according to a survey that is watched closely by Bank of England rate-setters.】

item.title: 金价突破5000美元关口，逢低买盘重返震荡市场
item.description: 金价突破每盎司5000美元大关，此前贵金属经历异常动荡的一周后，逢低买盘重返市场。【原文：Gold advanced above $5,000 an ounce, as dip-buyers returned to the market after an exceptionally volatile week for precious metals.】

item.title: 日本实际工资下滑持续全年，物价持续上涨
item.description: 2025年日本工人的实际工资逐月下降，凸显通胀持续存在，这为首相高市早苗在周日赢得压倒性选举胜利后继续推行更扩张性财政政策提供了依据。【原文：Japanese workers’ real wages fell in every month of 2025, underscoring the persistence of inflation and bolstering the case for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to continue down a more expansionary fiscal path after she secured a sweeping election victory on Sunday.】

item.title: YouTube正试图解决电视行业最大的问题：屏幕时间
item.description: YouTube即将推出面向体育迷和新闻爱好者的更实惠电视套餐组合。【原文：YouTube is going to start selling cheaper TV bundles for sports fans, news junkies】

item.title: 油价下跌，因中东局势缓和降低供应风险
item.description: 随着中东局势缓和，原油价格下跌，短期内供应中断的可能性降低。【原文：Oil declined as tensions in the Middle East eased, reducing the near-term chance of potential interruptions to supply.】

item.title: 中国正注入资金以填补4560亿美元的流动性缺口
item.description: 中国人民银行正加大向银行体系投放资金，以确保银行能够满足春节期间激增的现金需求。【原文：The People’s Bank of China is boosting the supply of money available to banks to ensure they can meet the surge in demand for cash during the Lunar New Year holidays.】

item.title: 蒙太奇集团筹集9.02亿美元后将登陆香港股市
item.description: 中国芯片设计公司蒙太奇科技公司以发行价区间上限完成股票发售，筹集资金9.02亿美元，即将于香港开始交易。【原文：Chinese chip designer Montage Technology Co. is set to begin trading in Hong Kong after a share sale that priced at the top of the offered range, raising $902 million.】

item.title: 星展银行利润低于预期，称今年盈利将下滑
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司公布的第四季度利润低于预期，主要受利率下降和税费增加的不利因素影响。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd. reported fourth-quarter profit that missed expectations due to headwinds from lower rates and higher tax expenses.】

item.title: 澳大利亚主要铁矿石港口随着飓风风险消退重新开放
item.description: 全球最大的铁矿石出口港在热带风暴过后重新开放。【原文：The world’s biggest iron ore export port reopened after the passing of a major tropical storm.】

item.title: 日元汇率因高市博胜选而波动，亚洲股市有望上涨：市场综述
item.description: 周一，随着日本首相高市早苗赢得历史性选举胜利，日元汇率出现波动；而亚洲股市在华尔街周五上涨后，本周开盘有望走高。【原文：The yen fluctuated Monday as Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi secured a historic election triumph, while Asian stocks looked set to open the week higher after Wall Street’s Friday rally.】

item.title: 斯塔默的英国首相宝座岌岌可危，核心助手突然辞职
item.description: 基尔·斯塔默的未来岌岌可危，此前因任命彼得·曼德尔森为驻华盛顿大使引发的危机，导致英国首相最亲密的助手下台。【原文：Keir Starmer’s future is in the balance after a crisis over the appointment of Peter Mandelson as ambassador to Washington claimed the UK prime minister’s closest aide.】

item.title: 研究显示本土初创企业表现优于归国科技人才
item.description: 印度竞争激烈的初创企业领域已提供证据表明，本土企业家在长期发展中表现优于拥有海外经验的归国侨民，这与普遍认知相悖。【原文：India’s fiercely competitive startup field has provided evidence to suggest that homegrown entrepreneurs fare better over the long run than returning diaspora with overseas experience, contradicting widely held beliefs.】

item.title: 沃什呼吁美联储与财政部达成协议，引发30万亿美元债券市场热议
item.description: 凯文·沃什在竞选美联储主席期间提出了诸多政策构想。对华尔街而言，他呼吁与财政部达成新协议的提议堪称最晦涩难解——也最具潜在影响力的主张。【原文：Kevin Warsh floated plenty of ideas for how he would run the Federal Reserve during his campaign for the job as chair. For Wall Street, few are as cryptic — or potentially consequential — as his call for a new accord with the Treasury Department.】

item.title: 日元汇率持稳，日本高市早苗有望在选举中取得压倒性胜利
item.description: 日本执政党自民党在周日众议院选举中赢得绝对多数席位后，日元汇率基本持平，这为首相高市早苗推行更多财政刺激政策铺平了道路。【原文：The yen was little changed after Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party won an outright majority in Sunday’s lower house election, opening the door to more fiscal stimulus by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.】

item.title: 历史性胜利：高市早苗的日本愿景与市场博弈
item.description: 去年十月，高市早苗还为争取足够议席以成为首相而苦苦挣扎。如今她已获得二战以来日本领导人最大的选举授权。【原文：Back in October, Sanae Takaichi struggled to wrangle enough seats in parliament to become prime minister. Now she has the biggest election mandate of any Japanese leader since World War II.】

item.title: 阿努廷赢得泰国大选为亲王室势力带来稳定契机
item.description: 自本世纪初以来，选举之夜通常对亲民主改革派而言是喜讯，对泰国保皇派而言却是噩耗。如今建制派终于支持了一位胜选者，泰国或许因此迎来稳定局面。【原文：Since the turn of the century, election night has usually been great for pro-democracy reformers and miserable for Thailand’s royalists. Now the establishment has finally backed a winner, and the country may see some stability as a result.】

item.title: 贝森特建议在司法部调查期间同步举行沃什提名听证会
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特建议参议院启动对唐纳德·特朗普提名的美联储主席人选的听证程序，尽管有共和党要员誓言在针对现任主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的刑事调查结束前，将阻挠所有此类提名推进。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested the Senate start hearings on Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Federal Reserve despite a vow from a key Republican to block all such nominations from advancing until a criminal investigation targeting current chair Jerome Powell is resolved.】

item.title: 日本金融厅长官片山和久表示，如有必要，周一将与市场进行沟通。
item.description: 日本财务大臣片山萨季表示，若必要将在周一与金融市场沟通。此前首相高市早苗赢得历史性选举胜利后，她试图向市场参与者传递早期安抚信号并发出警示。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama said she will communicate with financial markets on Monday if needed, as she tried to provide early reassurance and a warning for market players following a historic election win for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.】

item.title: 债权人行使抵押品赎回权后入股Allianca和Light
item.description: 曾为问题资产投资者纳尔逊·塔努雷提供融资的债权人，在执行其收购利加电信公司交易中作为抵押品的股份后，着手扣押其在Allianca Saude e Participacoes SA和Light SA的部分股权。【原文：Creditors who financed troubled-asset investor Nelson Tanure moved to seize part of his stakes in Allianca Saude e Participacoes SA and Light SA after executing shares pledged as collateral in a transaction tied to his acquisition of Ligga Telecomunicacoes SA.】

item.title: 泰国大选胜利为投资者带来政策延续性
item.description: 泰国执政党为泰党在周日选举中取得压倒性胜利，部分策略师和经济学家认为这将提振该国股市和货币。政策延续性的可能性令担忧政治功能失调加剧的投资者松了一口气。【原文：A convincing win by Thailand’s ruling Bhumjaithai Party in Sunday’s election should boost the country’s stock market and currency, according to some strategists and economists, with the potential for policy continuity a relief for investors who’d feared further political dysfunction.】

item.title: 贝森特认为中国"不守规矩"的交易行为是金价波动的幕后推手
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特指出，中国交易员是上周黄金市场剧烈波动的原因之一。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent cited Chinese traders as a reason behind last week’s wild swings in the gold market.】

item.title: 奥卡多或裁员近千人为削减成本：《泰晤士报》报道
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》报道，食品杂货科技公司奥卡多集团正计划大幅裁员，以重启削减成本的举措。【原文：Ocado Group Plc is planning to slash a significant number of jobs as the grocery technology firm renews efforts to cut costs, the Times newspaper reported.】

item.title: 高盛交易员警告：震荡市场中股票抛售尚未结束
item.description: 高盛集团交易部门称，美国股市上周五反弹几乎抹平了本周中期惨烈的跌幅，但本周将面临趋势跟随型算法基金的进一步抛售。【原文：After rebounding Friday to nearly erase a brutal mid-week slide, US stocks are facing more selling this week from trend-following algorithmic funds, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 监管机构失误后，埃斯孔电力公司可通过调高电价筹集34亿美元
item.description: 南非能源监管机构已批准国有企业埃斯康姆控股公司（Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.）上调电价，并在三年内收回547亿兰特（约合34亿美元）的损失。此前该公司因一系列定价失误，且私下解决此事的尝试失败。【原文：South Africa’s energy regulator has allowed state-owned Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. to raise tariffs and recover 54.7 billion rand ($3.4 billion) over three years after a series of pricing errors and a failed attempt to settle the matter privately.】

item.title: 博彩股走低，预测市场抢走超级碗投注
item.description: 超级碗本应是博彩公司年度日程中的重头戏。然而今年，随着这场盛大赛事的临近，整个行业却笼罩在阴云之下。【原文：The Super Bowl is supposed to be the highlight of the calendar for gambling companies. This year, though, a cloud has descended over the industry as the big game approached.】

item.title: 股市剧烈波动令华尔街最受欢迎的期权交易持续活跃
item.description: 欧美股市局部板块的波动尚未蔓延至更广泛的指数，这提振了押注市场进一步分化的期权策略需求。【原文：The volatility in pockets of the European and US equity markets has yet to engulf the broader indexes, boosting demand for option strategies betting on further dispersion.】

item.title: 沙特将公布2万亿美元经济计划的更新战略
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯计划发布更新版战略，以推进王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼的2万亿美元经济多元化议程。该王国正面临财政压力，正据此调整政策和支出优先事项。【原文：Saudi Arabia plans to release an updated strategy for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s $2 trillion economic diversification agenda as the kingdom adjusts its policies and spending priorities amid fiscal pressures.】
